TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE in GPE .
The applicant entered GPE in DATE . Until DATE he was in possession of a limited residence title for exceptional purposes ( NORP ) . In DATE he obtained an unlimited residence permit ( ORG ) .

The applicant ’s daughter was born in DATE . On DATE he requested a child - raising allowance for DATE of the child ’s life under the Child - raising LAW ( Bundeserziehungsgeldgesetz ) . For the applicant the benefits under that LAW amounted to MONEY ( DEM ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) per month .

On DATE ORG rejected his request . The applicant filed an administrative objection on DATE , which ORG dismissed on DATE . It held that the applicant did not meet the requirements of the Child - raising LAW as he was not a NORP national and he did not have the necessary unlimited residence permit . According to the relevant provisions of the Child - raising LAW , the limited residence title for exceptional purposes did not suffice for the allowance .
On DATE the applicant lodged an action with ORG ( ORG ) arguing that the pertinent provisions of the Child - raising LAW discriminated against foreign nationals .

In connection with a different set of proceeding ( concerning family allowance ) , the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint against , inter alia , the pertinent provisions of the Child - raising LAW , arguing that those provisions discriminated against foreigners . On DATE , ORG refused to admit the constitutional complaint for failure to exhaust effective remedies .

On DATE the applicant requested a child - raising allowance for DATE of his daughter ’s life . On DATE ORG rejected the request . On DATE it amended the decision and granted the applicant the requested allowance from DATE as on DATE the applicant was in the possession of an unlimited residence permit . The applicant filed an administrative objection against the refusal of the authorities to grant the allowance also for the period prior to DATE . On DATE ORG rejected the objection .
On DATE the applicant extended his action before ORG to include his claim for DATE of his daughter ’s life concerning the period before DATE .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s action in its entirety , holding that the applicant did not meet the requirements of the Child - raising LAW . It also held that that LAW ’s requirement for foreign nationals to be in possession of a residence permit was not discriminatory . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against the judgment .

On DATE the ORG ( ORG ) allowed an ancillary request concerning a cost decision but dismissed the appeal on the merits in its entirety . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law against that judgment .
On DATE the defendant acknowledged that the applicant ’s claim on the merits was justified in so far as it concerned the DATE period of CARDINAL and DATE .
On DATE ORG ( Bundessozialgericht ) dismissed the appeal on points of law .
On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint to ORG ( Bundesverfassungsgericht ) .

On DATE ORG held , in proceedings by which the applicant was not directly concerned , that the pertinent provisions of the LAW violated the right to equal treatment enshrined in LAW ( case no . CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . It added that if the Child - raising LAW was not amended until DATE , the law prior to the amendment of the Child - raising Allowance Act in DATE should be applied to cases that were not subject to a final decision . On DATE , ORG also declared , for the same reasons , the provisions of LAW ( GPE ) to be unconstitutional ( case ORG . CARDINAL BvL CARDINAL , CARDINAL , and CARDINAL ) , also allowing for a transitional period until DATE .
In relation to the applicant ’s constitutional complaint ORG , on DATE , rescinded the judgment of ORG referring to its earlier decision of DATE .

It remitted the case to ORG and decided that ORG was to adjourn the case until the impugned provisions of the LAW had been amended . ORG added , in line with its earlier decision , that if the LAW was not amended until DATE , ORG should apply the law prior to the amendment of the Child - raising LAW in DATE .
On DATE the defendant acknowledged the applicant ’s claim ; on DATE it also offered to pay interest on the outstanding amount .

On DATE the NORP legislator amended the Child - raising LAW to allow foreigners with limited residence titles for exceptional purposes , whose proceedings had not yet ended with a final decision , to benefit from the child - raising allowance . This amendment entered into force retroactively on DATE .

On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law . ORG noted that the applicant had not accepted the defendant ’s acknowledgment . It ordered the defendant to pay the agreed child - raising allowance plus the accrued interest .
